sen.j: 夜都岐神社（やつぎじんじゃ）は、奈良県天理市にある神社である。
sen.e: Yatsugi-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
Yatsugi-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
Yatsugi-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 旧社格は村社。
sen.e: The shrine was designated as a village shrine in the old shrine ranking
The shrine was designated as a village shrine under the old shrine ranking system.
The shrine was designated as a village shrine under the old shrine ranking system.

sen.j: 夜都伎神社とも書かれ、「やつき」「やとぎ」などとも読まれる。
sen.e: Yatsugi-jinja Shrine is written as "夜都岐神社" or "夜都伎神社" in Chinese characters, while also being called as 'Yatsuki-jinja Shrine' or 'Yatogi-jinja Shrine.'
Yatsugi-jinja Shrine is written using the characters "夜都岐神社" or "夜都伎神社," which can also be read 'Yatsuki-jinja Shrine' or 'Yatogi-jinja Shrine.'
Yatsugi-jinja Shrine is written using the characters "夜都岐神社" or "夜都伎神社," which can also be read 'Yatsuki-jinja Shrine' or 'Yatogi-jinja Shrine.'

sen.j: 乙木（おとぎ）集落の北端に鎮座する。
sen.e: It is enshrined in the northern end of Otogi village.
It is located at the northern end of Otogi village.
It is located at the northern end of Otogi village.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳「大和国山辺郡 夜都伎神社」の論社である（他の論社は同市竹之内町の十二神社 (天理市)と田井庄町の八剣神社 (天理市)）。
sen.e: The shrine is a Ronja (shrines considered to be descendants of a shikinai-sha [shrine listed in Engishiki laws]) of a shrine registered in Engishiki Jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan), 'Yatsugi-jinja Shrine in Yamabe County, Yamato Province' (Juni-jinja Shrine in Takenouchi-cho, Tenri City and Yatsurugi-jinja Shrine in Tainosho-cho, Tenri City are other Ronja).

The shrine is thought to be the descendant of the shikinaisha (shrine listed in the Engishiki Jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) 'Yatsugi-jinja Shrine in Yamabe County, Yamato Province' (Juni-jinja Shrine in Takenouchi-cho, Tenri City and Yatsurugi-jinja Shrine in Tainosho-cho, Tenri City are theorized as being predecessors).

The shrine is thought to be the descendant of the shikinaisha (shrine listed in the Engishiki Jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) 'Yatsugi-jinja Shrine in Yamabe County, Yamato Province' (Juni-jinja Shrine in Takenouchi-cho, Tenri City and Yatsurugi-jinja Shrine in Tainosho-cho, Tenri City are theorized as being predecessors).

sen.j: 夜都岐は、於都岐（乙木）の誤写とする説もある。
sen.e: A theory suggests that this shrine was initially written as "於都岐(乙木)神社" in Chinese characters, which were miscopied to be "夜都岐神社."
A theory suggests that the name of this shrine was initially written "於都岐(乙木)神社," which were mistranscribed as "夜都岐神社."
A theory suggests that the name of this shrine was initially written "於都岐(乙木)神社," which were mistranscribed as "夜都岐神社."

sen.j: 全国にある八剣神社との関係の可能性も考えられる。
sen.e: There is a possibility that Yatsurugi -jinja Shrine scattered nationwide have some relationships with the shrine's name of "Yatsugi-jinja Shrine."
There is a possibility that the Yatsurugi -jinja Shrine located nationwide have a relationship to this shrine.
There is a possibility that the Yatsurugi -jinja Shrine located nationwide have a relationship to this shrine.

sen.j: 祭神は、武甕槌命・姫大神・経津主命・天児屋根命。
sen.e: This shrine enshrines Takemikazuchi-no-mikoto, Hime-no-okami, Futsunushi-no-mikoto and Amenokoyane-no-mikoto.
This shrine enshrines Takemikazuchi-no-mikoto, Hime-no-okami, Futsunushi-no-mikoto and Amenokoyane-no-mikoto.
This shrine enshrines Takemikazuchi-no-mikoto, Hime-no-okami, Futsunushi-no-mikoto and Amenokoyane-no-mikoto.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 乙木には元は夜都伎神社と春日神社の2社があった。
sen.e: Originally, there were two shrines in Otogi village, Yatsugi-jinja Shrine and Kasuga-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Originally, there were two shrines in Otogi village; Yatsugi-jinja Shrine and Kasuga-jinja Shrine.
Originally, there were two shrines in Otogi village; Yatsugi-jinja Shrine and Kasuga-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 夜都伎神社の社地を約400m東南の竹之内の三間塚池（現在の十二神社の社地）と交換した。
sen.e: Of them, Yatsugi-jinja Shrine was transferred to Sagizuka-ike Pond in Takenouchi-cho (the present Juni-jinja Shrine's land) located about 400m southeast of the original place through the exchange of the shrines' lands.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: One of these, Yatsugi-jinja Shrine, was transferred to Sagizuka-ike Pond in Takenouchi-cho (the present Juni-jinja Shrine's land) located about 400m southeast of the original place through an exchange of the shrines' lands.

One of these, Yatsugi-jinja Shrine, was transferred to Sagizuka-ike Pond in Takenouchi-cho (the present Juni-jinja Shrine's land) located about 400m southeast of the original place through an exchange of the shrines' lands.

sen.j: 乙木は春日神社1社のみとして社名を夜都伎神社に改めたものと伝えられる。
sen.e: As a result, only Kasuga-jinja Shrine remained in Otogi village to be renamed "Yatsugi-jinja Shrine," it is widely believed.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: As a result, only Kasuga-jinja Shrine remained in Otogi village it is said that it was renamed 'Yatsugi-jinja Shrine.'
As a result, only Kasuga-jinja Shrine remained in Otogi village is said to have been renamed 'Yatsugi-jinja Shrine.'
sen.cmt: 文意に合うように書き換えました。

sen.j: 乙木村は、古くは興福寺大乗院及び春日大社領の乙木荘で、そのため春日大神を当地に勧請したものとみられる。
sen.e: Since Otogi village used to be the Otsugi manor, the estate of Kofuku-ji Temple Daijo-in and Kasuga Taisha Shrine, Otogi village presumably enshrined the divided Kasuga-no-kami.
Since Otogi village used to be Otsugi manor, the estate of Kofuku-ji Temple Daijo-in and Kasuga Taisha Shrine, Otogi village presumably enshrined the divided Kasuga-no-kami.
Since Otogi village used to be Otsugi manor, the estate of Kofuku-ji Temple Daijo-in and Kasuga Taisha Shrine, Otogi village presumably enshrined the divided Kasuga-no-kami.

sen.j: 約200ｍ北に東乗鞍古墳、約300ｍ北西に西乗鞍古墳があり、当地も宮山（たいこ山）と呼ばれ、古墳を削平して神社を造営したと言われている。
sen.e: Considering the geographical conditions surrounding the shrine with Higashinorikura Tumulus in about 200m north and Nishinorikura Tumulus in about 300m northwest, as well as the fact that the shrine's land used to be called Mt. Taiko, the shrine is believed to have been built after flattening a tumulus.

Considering the geographical conditions surrounding the shrine with Higashinorikura Tumulus about 200m to the north and Nishinorikura Tumulus about 300m northwest, as well as the fact that the shrine's land used to be called Mt. Taiko, the shrine is believed to have been built after flattening a tumulus.

Considering the geographical conditions surrounding the shrine with Higashinorikura Tumulus about 200m to the north and Nishinorikura Tumulus about 300m northwest, as well as the fact that the shrine's land used to be called Mt. Taiko, the shrine is believed to have been built after flattening a tumulus.

sen.j: 春日大社との関係が深く、江戸時代末期まで「蓮の御供」という神饌を献上していた。
sen.e: Having a close relation with Kasuga Taisha Shrine, Yatsugi-jinja Shrine had presented Shinsen (food and alcohol offering to the deities) called 'Hasu-no-goku' (literally, offering of lotus) until the end of Edo period.

Having a close relationship with Kasuga Taisha Shrine, Yatsugi-jinja Shrine had presented a shinsen (food and alcohol offering to the deities) called 'Hasu-no-goku' (literally, offering of lotus) until the end of Edo period.

Having a close relationship with Kasuga Taisha Shrine, Yatsugi-jinja Shrine had presented a shinsen (food and alcohol offering to the deities) called 'Hasu-no-goku' (literally, offering of lotus) until the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 春日大社からは、古くなった社殿・鳥居を60年毎に夜都岐神社に下賜して使用させる伝統がある。
sen.e: Kasuga Taisha Shrine has traditionally given antiquated buildings and Torii (shrine gate) to Yatsugi-jinja Shrine every 60 years.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kasuga Taisha Shrine has traditionally its old buildings and torii (shrine gates) to Yatsugi-jinja Shrine every 60 years.
Kasuga Taisha Shrine has traditionally its old buildings and torii (shrine gates) to Yatsugi-jinja Shrine every 60 years.

sen.j: 応永13年（1406年）には春日大社の第四殿を下賜されている（春日大社文書）。
sen.e: Kasuga Taisha Shrine gave its fourth sanctuary to Yatsugi-jinja Shrine in 1406 (the source: "Kasuga Taisha Bunsho" [Documents of Kasuga Taisha Shrine]).
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kasuga Taisha Shrine gave its fourth sanctuary to Yatsugi-jinja Shrine in 1406 (source: "Kasuga Taisha Bunsho" [Documents of Kasuga Taisha Shrine]).
Kasuga Taisha Shrine gave its fourth sanctuary to Yatsugi-jinja Shrine in 1406 (source: "Kasuga Taisha Bunsho" [Documents of Kasuga Taisha Shrine]).

sen.j: また、寛正2年（1461年）4月6日には大乗院の尋尊が参詣に訪れている（大乗院寺社雑事記）。
sen.e: Moreover, Jinson, a priest of Daijo-in Temple visited to the shrine on April 6, 1461 (the source: "Daijoin Jisha Zojiki" [Miscellaneous Records of Daijo-in Temple]).
Moreover, Jinson, a priest of Daijo-in Temple visited to the shrine on April 6, 1461 (source: "Daijoin Jisha Zojiki" [Miscellaneous Records of Daijo-in Temple]).
Moreover, Jinson, a priest of Daijo-in Temple visited to the shrine on April 6, 1461 (source: "Daijoin Jisha Zojiki" [Miscellaneous Records of Daijo-in Temple]).

sen.j: 西には、神宮寺である十来子（じゅうらいし：十羅刹）堂があったが、現在は乙木集落中の薬師堂に移されている。
sen.e: There used to be Juraishi-do Temple, a Jingu-ji temple (temple associated with shrine) in the west, which is now in Yakushi-do Hall located within Otogi village after being transferred.
Juraishi-do Temple, a jingu-ji (temple associated with a shrine) once stood to the west, but this was moved to the Yakushi-do Hall in Otogi Village.
Juraishi-do Temple, a jingu-ji (temple associated with a shrine) once stood to the west, but this was moved to the Yakushi-do Hall in Otogi Village.

sen.j: 拝殿は、この地方では珍しい萱葺である。
sen.e: Haiden (a hall of worship) is covered with a thatched roof that is unusual in this district.
The haiden (worship hall) is topped by a thatched roof, which is unusual in this area.
The haiden (worship hall) is topped by a thatched roof, which is unusual in this area.
